We had the best time at Hyatt Regency SOMA! 
The hotel is beautiful, very clean and offers spectacular views over San Francisco downtown.
The rooms are spacious, the beds are big very comfortable and we really appreciated the fact that everything was spotless. 
The breakfast was amazing- there was everything for everyone, and the service was absolutely impeccable. The restaurant staff went above and beyond to provide the best customer experience. 
Everyone at the hotel was lovely but one of the receptionists really stood out to us. Estefhani was absolutely brilliant. She was always nice and helpful and gave us good tips on our sightseeing days. 
I cannot recommend this hotel more and many thanks to everyone who provided us with such an unforgettable experience.

review_title: An excellent stay at a wonderful San Diego hotel
good_review: This is an excellent hotel, and I had a wonderful stay here. The staff was nice, especially the head bartender and the receptionist who handled my evening check in. The room was clean and comfortable, and it is clear the whole property is renovated and superbly maintained. The lobby was nicely decorated for the holidays as well. I also had breakfast from the  la carte menu at the restaurant (no buffet option was offered, but no matter), ordered room service once which was very good, and visited the full coffee shop in the lobby. The hotel also took care of some laundry during my stay, which was done impeccably. There is also a bottle-filling water fountain on the lower level that was very handy. All in all, I would highly recommend this excellent hotel in San Diego/La Jolla.
bad_review: Upon check in, I was told I would not be billed for my stay until I checked out, and my charge card would only be held on file just in case. However, on the second day of my stay, I found that I had already been billed in full, plus an incidentals fee that is automatically applied as a precaution. After a few days, I noticed this charge had been removed, and I wasn't billed again until a few days after I had checked out. I wish I had not had this initial charge on my card, and could have varied my payment method, but this did not seem possible. I also found the miscellaneous/precautious incidentals fee to be somewhat ambiguous. While this is a minor detail, it is worth mentioning, as it is the only negative aspect of my stay. I also found the cost to be a bit high, but it was SoCal during the holidays at a prime hotel, so that's to be expected.

acommodation: Suite de 1 dormitorio con 2 camas grandes y sof谩 cama
review_title: Very good - unusual location but ultimately very good.
good_review: This is a new facility so it is well-presented and clean. Rooms were well-sized and appointed and great to have a kitchen area. It is a different location because there is not too much in the immediate vicinity (one chain restaurant and a coffee shop I think) and there is a quiet university vibe. However we found the place to be incredibly well located to all of LA's awesome attractions with a car and very very safe and good value for money. It is close to motorway access so very easy to get around LA - we got to Santa Monica in 25 minutes on a Sunday, 10 minutes from Dodger Stadium, 20 minutes from Universal Studious, 20 minutes to Hollywood, 10-15 minutes to Downtown. Value for money was really good, a great hotel that provides easy access to everything in LA. The sacrifice is that there are not too many shops etc in walking distance but the reality is that you need a car to get around LA anyway. And it felt very very safe, I'm glad I didn't stay in some of the downtown locations I had also been looking at because I saw some of these on my travels and while the buildings looked fine - what they don't show is the surrounding neighbourhoods - unfortunately there are too many spots in LA with homeless issues.

good_review:
I booked a room that was supposed to be large enough for 4 adults and 3 children (according to the add on booking.com), but in reality was only enough for 3 adults.
I had no problem booking another room, but I was charged more than twice of what I paid for the first room. In addition, I have a conformation about having a room on the main floor, when the hotel doesnt even have a main floor. Our rooms were a block away from the elevators, and the stairs (that were closer to our rooms) were locked. Some of the receptacles in the room did not work, and you can hear every noise or tv from rooms all around. booking.com should make it clear that Parking is not included and that pets are an extra cost.
I ended up paying close to a $1,000USD for 2 nights in noisy 2-3 stars hotel. 
Thats definitely the last time I book through booking.com

review_title: Lovely city centre hotel in the heart of San Francisco
good_review: We stayed at the Grand Hyatt for one night during our honeymoon and we loved the city centre location. Upon check-in we were upgraded to a bigger room which overlooked Union Square. This was a lovely surprise and a brilliant gesture from the hotel staff! Everything is within easy walking distance and there are plenty of public transport options nearby to make getting around even easier. There are plenty of great shops nearby (Macys, Bloomingdales etc) as well as some great late night bars. We went to a speakeasy called Local Edition which is about 0.4 miles from the hotel - can highly recommend. We didnt have a chance to sample the food or drink at the on site bar/restaurant but it all looked lovely from what we saw. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking to do some sight-seeing in San Francisco as its a great base!

good_review: Stylish rooms, generally very comfortable and had everything you needed (coffee machine, fancy toiletries, mini fridge). Staff were all friendly and helpful. Overall a very pleasant stay.
bad_review:
Some rooms have doors between them, presumably to accommodate larger groups booking adjoining rooms. These doors aren't particularly soundproof however and we could hear the people next door (not part of our group). 
Also if you're in a room facing the road then you may notice traffic noise as I think the windows are single glazed. Neither of these things bothered us much, or were unexpected for a city centre hotel, but those preferring a quiet room may wish to request a higher floor / not road facing.

acommodation: Habitaci贸n con balc贸n y vistas a la ciudad - 1 cama extragrande
good_review: The hotel location in Japantown was perfect. Parking was easy in the city parking garage attacked to the hotel. The staff was excellent, so attentive and kind. The lobby area was huge and had so many great seating areas for relaxing. There was also a 24/7 coffee/tea station which was great. We spent an afternoon downstairs just reading on a sofa, which was lovely. The room itself was simple and clean. The bathroom was not luxurious, but perfectly adequate. The buffet breakfast (an extra cost) was great. Huge variety and good quality food. Would highly recommend this hotel to others visiting the city, especially anyone hoping to avoid the downtown area which can be very busy.
bad_review: My only slight complaint was that there is no separate light in the toilet and no door to the sink area outside so in the middle of the night the option was either to pee in the dark or turn on a light that would very likely wake up anyone else in the room. Overall this was just a minor inconvenience and the lobby, staff and location of the hotel more than made up for it! We would stay there again for sure!

Our toilet overflowed and a crew had to be sent for clean up and repairs. Very inconvenient. Staff could have been friendlier and we were never offered anything complimentary for the toilet situation. We checked out a day early and made sure the evening before checkout that it was ok and no penalty would be incurred only to be met with a different answer in the morning which required a manager to resolve. So that was upsetting on a last note especially with the toilet situation a couple nights prior.

Habitaci贸n con cama extragrande.
review_title: I'd stay in and recommend the hip, freshly-renovated Hotel Kabuki in safe Japantown over and over.
good_review: Very stylish, unique hotel. And in 2023, it's important to add that it's in a safe neighborhood. Hotel Kabuki is rightly on many lists like the 10 Coolest Hotels in San Francisco and the very Best Boutique Hotels in San Francisco. I agree. I've lived in San Francisco for almost 30 years and know the neighborhoods well. While renovating our apartment, I had to find a room near home last minute. I looked extensively online and found other hip, beautiful hotels in SF, but once I saw the neighborhood or cross streets, I knocked them off the list because of how seedy the areas are now. Hotel Kabuki is the rare gem that is All. The. Things. The aesthetics are a 10 out of 10. The hotel strikes an eyebrow-raising balance between artistic and minimalist. The staff is top-notch, welcoming, warm, professional. The beds, pillows, and sheets are incredibly comfortable. Everything is super clean and fresh. The lounge is so inviting it was impossible not to enjoy my complimentary coffee in it before leaving. Two big thumbs up. I love it. (Photos by Jessica Kay and Aubrie Pick)
bad_review: The parking lot was full when I arrived, albeit it late at night. On the bright side, I found a parking spot right across the street, and because the meter was broken, I ended up getting FREE parking (FYI: it's a metered spot on the northwest side of Post Street near Buchanan in front of Sally's Salon). In a city where hotel parking ranges from $40-$100 per night, that was a fun win. There was lots of open street parking, and the meters start at 9 AM, so it's not a bad idea to park on the street. There's also a Japantown parking lot right down the block. If Hotel Kabuki were in a different neighborhood, I might not recommend street parking, but it's quiet, calm, and safe here.

acommodation: Suite
review_title: great facilities, avoid sofa bed at all costs.
good_review:
The sofa bed was terrible! The cushion is almost obsolete and you can feel the springs just be feeling the cushions with your fingers. I got severe back pain on the second night that has stayed with me throughout my trip so far and really dampened my spirits. I ended up using the couch cushions as a mattress on the floor. 
Our room was spacious and nice, except it was too dark near our bed (the area near the window was nice though!). The facilities were super nice free coffee and water 24/7, the gym is stunning and spacious and it was right on the cusp of japantown. Super easy to just walk out and go explore! Parking seems difficult if you have a car with a small lot with limited spaces. My parents thought the actual bed was comfortable, so would be good for 2 people but absolutely not a choice for 3 if youre counting on the sofa bed.

review_title: A great place to stay in San Francisco.
good_review: The hotel staff are really friendly and it was very welcoming after a long road trip. Very clean room and the view from the hotel balcony is beautiful. The shower is spacious and all of the hygiene necessities were provided to us. Large TV with access to streaming services and wifi is provided. Location is close to restaurants (walking distance) and a large Japanese market place. Parking for the hotel itself is small, but it is also clean with a nice aesthetic. There is another parking lot, but from my understanding it was paid parking (I didn't have to use it however, so I am not sure on specifics) The surrounding area is very lively in the day (lots of foot traffic), but quiets down at night. Overall a very safe area and very enjoyable place to stay.

acommodation: Habitaci贸n Doble - 2 camas dobles y sof谩 cama
good_review: Its a new modern hotel situated in a good location. Parking is easy, though there is no shade.
bad_review:
The rooms werent very clean. We stayed twice and both times we found stains in the carpets, dust build up on the ice buckets and on other surfaces, kids/dog toys and garbage under the beds, and drips of something (who knows what?) on the desk and nightstand. The cleaning staff regularly pulls down their face masks when in public areas of the hotel, so we could only imagine they didnt wear them when cleaning the rooms. It seems that the hotel is in need of a rooms manager to conduct thorough cleaning checks (or better training and adherence if that role already exists). During the pandemic, I cant tell you how much of a turn off a leas than immaculate room feels  especially when you a staying with kids who want to touch everything.
This hotel does not provide luggage valets in the rooms by default  there is a space for them, but its empty. So you have nowhere to open your suitcase other than the (dirty) floor. We found out you can call for them to be delivered to your room, but expect to get all kinds of attitude about how they dont have room service at this hotel and expect to wait up yo an hour for this basic hotel equipment to be delivered.
Most staff (except housekeeping staff) wore their masks properly. Though there were signs everywhere requiring face masks to be worn in all public areas of the hotel, this was not enforced by staff at all. At least half of the guests did not wear masks, even when directly in front of the front desk clerk.
The pool area could use some attention  it just looked neglected. Way too much chlorine in the water too.
There are not ice machines in every floor, and they wont deliver ice to your room so youll have to go hunting for the machines on every other floor.
Breakfast was not so great, though the attendants were friendly. Expect powdered eggs that are watery and overcooked. Bruised bananas were the only fresh fruit option  most of them had broken peels. Orange juice was something akin to Tang.

bad_review: Biggest issue was lack of cleanliness. This is a NEW hotel, so keeping it looking great shouldnt be hard. The gym was filthy the 1st 4 days of my stay, until I complained! The treadmills were moved at some point, and the marks left on the floor with clumps of hair stuck to them should have been addressed immediately, whenever they moved them. Terrible value for money, as I didnt even use the gym like I wanted to. I also requested a bath tub; it wouldve been nice if they were more accommodating. I needed 2 beds as well and was told the only room with a tub was a king bed. That wouldve been fine, if they had informed me the rooms all come with sofa beds too, fulfilling the need for 2nd bed. Also, why the heck was the lobby so hot? Friends met me and we were sitting there starting to sweat! Seriously? The staff was friendly enough, but Id never stay here again based on the constant filth everywhere. And if you have a hotel with white tile, you need to commit to frequent moppings in high traffic areas. Gross. I was embarrassed to have booked this for my family.

good_review: The staff was very friendly. Was in a good part of town, close to shopping, restaurants, and a gas station. Lots of parking and very well lit at night, so felt very safe coming in at night. Room was large with a sitting area, and bathroom was a great size too. Beautiful modern design to the room. It had a small refrigerator for a few drinks and some food. Nice large TV.
bad_review: I checked several reviews, and while it was stated the cleaning could have been better, I am sad to say its still not where it should be. Dust, drink stains and the small coffee pot was dirty. I understand covid is an issue and would not want anyone to be at risk, but getting our trash removed from the room and a couple of towels would have been nice. Was going to take my trash bags to the trash container by the elevator, but that one was overflowing. I saw another guest besides myself asking for towels and trash bags. The bathroom door squeak so loud, and for a new hotel one would think that would have been fixed. Our room was above the dumpsters (bad location for all of us that had rooms on that side), so every morning at 6 am there was a racket from that. One fault with the parking lot in the back leads out to another street, so people constantly driving and cutting through the parking lot. The lightning is so bright (cool white LEDs) we had to put dark bags over the lamps. Suggestion, replace the cool white with a warm white LED.

bad_review:
New hotels should not have mold in and around the shower. They should also advise that they only service rooms every 4 days, so it you want any extra towels, pick them up at the desk. This also means trash is always setting in the halls. 
They advertise breakfast with this room, but out of 3 days, 2 off which had nothing but coffee. The other was a waiting line for a bowl of cereal (after a member of the morning staff on Saturday promised a "Real hot breakfast!" for us Sunday. That was missing. 
The icing on the cake was the trash truck dumping several dumpsters at 5:30 AM. 
Check out was like dealing with a robot. The only thing he said was, " do you need a print out, and there ya go!" and went of to continue his work. 
Thanks would have been customary, "how was your stay? " would have been considerate. Going over the invoice would have been efficient. Eye contact would have possibly given me an opportunity to tell him about my visit and my future visits. 
None of those things happened.

bad_review: The access. Despite a sweeping driveway up to their front doors, access is through a parking garage at the rear. The signage is confusing, as are the directions sent on the day of arrival, and parking, unloading, checking in and moving again is such a hassle, even after you locate the right entrance. Hopefully it is only bureaucracy keeping the front driveway from use. A better restaurant would also be welcome. The current bar and restaurant staff are fantastic, but the menu is basically diner food. We went next door for really great sushi, but in an equally diner like atmosphere.

acommodation: Habitaci贸n con cama extragrande.
review_title: 1 night stay at Hyatt house LAX, October.
good_review:
Nice enough room, clean tidy, quiet on ground floor just round from reception which we found weird but was ok. Bed was very comfortable and we had a good night's sleep. Food and drinks at the bar was well priced and very nice and service was excellent from the staff. And breakfast early next morning had a good selection of food to choose from, very enjoyable.
Also iin your room is a coffee percolator only, no kettle for boiling hot water but that's more a kKwi/Aussie / British thing for making a pot of tea so we were disappointed in that but for Americans who drink perc coffee it will tick the box ok.
Bathroom was clean and shower had reasonable pressure and plenty of hot water.
bad_review:
Room was a bit dark we thought, needs more lights as made it a little difficult to see properly as no main light for the room, more mood lighting and bedside lights.
Also Worst thing is though DO NOT LEAVE ANYTHING BEHIND IN THE ROOM. You will NOT get it back. We tried multiple phone calls, emails, going direct to hotel, Main Hyatt reservations, even they could not reach anyone at the hotel. Absolutely useless unfortunately. My partner left 2 jackets behind which she was so peed off with herself for doing so that was our fault, but, even through booking .com, there has not to date been any response from Hyatt House. Left messages on phone of a guy called Corey at Hyatt,. Nothing,! No response to any contacts and good luck trying to get through to reception, they just don't answer the phone. Staff to deal with in person were really good but no one answers the phone if you can get through to the hotel.
We were happy to pay for courier forwarding or return shipping to NZ but NOTHING, ZIP
So do not leave anything behind unless you can actually physically go back to the hotel.
Other than that, nothing really at the hotel is bad.

acommodation: Suite Estudio con cocina y sof谩 cama - Cama extragrande
good_review: The hotel is conveniently located about a 10-minute drive from Los Angeles Airport and offers a complimentary airport shuttle service. The shuttle runs every 15-20 minutes, without the need for prior reservations, making it extremely convenient for travelers.
bad_review:
Check-in is available from 3 PM; however, during my stay, we arrived at 3:55 PM only to be informed that our room was not yet ready. We had to wait for almost an hour until our room was finally prepared, which was quite dissatisfying.The room type we booked was a King Suite, with a spacious 37-square-meter area that included a separate bathroom and kitchenette.
In the bathroom, the sink setup was basic, with the hairdryer and amenities placed underneath it. There were no drawers for storage, and the countertop space was limited.
The kitchenette, on the other hand, was well-equipped with utensils and cooking tools. It was convenient for making coffee and preparing simple meals, which was a positive aspect of our stay.
Overall, despite the convenient location and the inclusion of a complimentary airport shuttle, the delay in check-in and the shortcomings in the bathroom design were disappointing. However, the kitchenette provided a satisfactory experience for our needs.

acommodation: Habitaci贸n con cama extragrande.
good_review: We do not know how the breakfast was because it was closed at 9.30am! I tried to get something to eat at 9.45 and they suggested to wait until the restaurant open at 11am. I also missed the breakfast which was included in the price due to this abnormal breakfast time (until 9.30am).
bad_review:
I left my leather jacket in another hotel earlier in our trip in the US and I asked that hotel to ship it to Hilton House before we arrived. When I checked at the reception in the morning they did not find the package, for almost an hour. Then I checked with the other hotel who gave me the USPS tracking number so I could print it and show at the reception that it was indeed delivered. After that they found it within 2 minutes!
It was not too much more time that we had to leave for the terminal as our aircraft was about to leave. I almost missed my jacket at Hyatt House LAX.

acommodation: Habitaci贸n con cama extragrande.
review_title: Unless you are staying here to fly out of LAX, look elsewhere
good_review: The property was a newer built facility which is always nice however, thats where the things I liked stopped.
bad_review: We were given the room right outside the elevator next to the ice machine facing the airport so we were disrupted by every plane that took off. The pillows were uncomfortable, the bed was uncomfortable, the planes were loud but the thing I hated most was the parking. $23 to park but you cant leave or $46 if you wanted in and out privileges. What? Everything is done by you! No valet- its all self park so whats the difference? Also, the $46 spots were normal size but the $23 dollar spots were so narrow that they barely fit a motorcycle. We watched a family get out of their car, then the dad parked it and crawled out the back tailgate because he couldnt open his door once he pulled into the spot. Even the couple seated next to me commented on how small it was. The bowls are deceiving as they are more like a soup bowl with a rim, so it looked like a smaller portion than what it was. It wasnt even filled to the top of the soup bowl. it was along the bottom, but it costed over $20 for it. It didnt ruin my trip, but it was kind of annoying. Also the front desk is so small and there were two people helping one man while everyone stood there waiting. I stood in the line that was forming behind the first person and had my luggage and they finally grabbed the next person in line. I waited and when it was my turn, a man walked up from the restaurant and just kind of stood on the side and the gal that was at the front desk, looked up to him and asked if she could help. She totally didnt acknowledge the line that was there, or me with my luggage. They need to have some sort of system so that guests arent ignored. She didnt even look up from helping the first guy, to see who was standing there, while her and the other guy were assisting the first guy. its like when you stand in a grocery line and then the cashier goes to open up a new line and takes the last person in the row who just got there. How about take the first person who is waiting?

good_review: The location to the airport was excellent. Room was very large in comparison to everything else we had stayed in while holidaying for a month in the States. bad_review: I would like this passed on to the Hyatt Regency Management as I was disgusted with the erratic behaviour of the courtesy coach driver from the hotel to the airport on Friday 16/6/23 at approximately 4.05pm. He had grey curly unruly shoulder length hair. His driving was scary - the young woman seated opposite me mouthed "holy crap", he suffered road rage where he was continually honking the horn and waving his arms in the air. Erratic driving. What really offended me was he got out at our stop at Terminal B at the airport with his hand held out for a tip. He had a wad of money in his hand as if indicating what he expected. My partner handed over a $100 bill (not realising it was a $100 bill) to which I snatched it out of his hand and said "there is no way you will be tipping him that for god sake". The driver's response was "I have change" to which I said I wanted $95.00 change. I then realised I had $5 in my wallet and kept telling him (while his back was turned as he was still trying to find change for the $100 bill) that I had $5 and I felt there was no way he deserved that. I had no intention of giving him a tip as for me a tip is recognising great service. He was appalling and should be sacked. Absolutely disgusting behaviour and Management need to be aware of this

acommodation: Habitaci贸n con cama extragrande y ba帽era adaptada - Adaptada para personas de movilidad reducida
good_review: The hotel is very close to the airport and, since I had a 6am flight, it made a lot of sense to stay there for my very short stay. The room was spacious and clean. The staff was extremely nice and professional. All in all, this property has a relaxing and airy vibe that will suit anxious travelers. I am not one of them, but I almost felt on vacation, even though I was on a business trip! Also, the airport shuttle runs every 10-15 minutes, which is extremely convenient.
bad_review: The free wifi was spotty at best, which was surprising for such a modern hotel. And this hotel also has a policy of charging $100 for early check-in, like more and more properties. I think this is not right and if a room is ready for a guest to check in, then they should be allowed to have it when they arrive. As a very frequent business traveler, I have sometimes had to wait in the lobby for a room to become available, and I completely understand that. But to charge someone extra, just because their flight arrives at a certain time is simply not right. (And I worked for 5 years in a hotel as a receptionist, so I have LOTS of opinions about how a hotel should be run! LOL)

Initial problems at check in as the hotel had cancelled our booking! However, our room was still available and we were checked in quickly.
The room was excellent - we were overlooking a busy road junction and, just beyond, the airport, but there was no external noise noticeable in the room at all!
Facilities were very good.
We ate in the bar area on the evening we arrived, and had breakfast the next morning - both meals were very good.
But the highest of our praises go to the staff. Every single one of them that we met were a credit to the hotel - from the guy on reception sorting out our cancelled booking, to the restaurant staff, houseeepers, check out staff and valet parking crew...a fantastic team of people providing great service. We won't hesitate to book this hotel again next time we need to stay near LAX!

Were over 65 and wanted to break the long flight home from London to Brisbane, Australia. We spent 2 nights here. The room was a great size with King bed (comfortable)and also a sofa. We enjoyed the view of the runway. There are was a little noise from planes but didnt stop us from sleeping. 
Breakfast was ok, a few hot dishes including scrambled egg, cereal, fruit etc. 
the staff were great, always friendly and willing to help. We had a few drinks at the bar and ate there both nights. Food was good but expensive. 
There was a Starbucks next door which was good for a morning latte!
We had a late flight home and there was no problem leaving our bags when we went out for the day!

(This was very confusing)The hotel message said which shuttle to get on and didnt say you had to call shuttle. The airport message was correct. When we arrived by airport the shuttle dropped us at back of hotel (which hotel message said would happen) Better signage to show way to back entrance would have been helpful and easy to do!

While showering the hand bar, which was not properly secured, came out of the wall, causing me to fall and hurt my knee, which ended up bruising and painful for about 1 week. The incident was reported immediately to staff on duty at the front desk (Diego Andrada), at which point he sent "engineers" to verify the problem, which they did.
Diego asked if I could wait a few minutes to contact management to deal with me for compensation.
After waiting a bit longer, Diego suggested that I not wait any longer as management was not available, but to email to him my concerns, which I did on August 10 along with a photo of the disattached bar.
After receiving no reply I sent an email once agian with still no reply.
This is obviously not acceptable and certainly expect to receive compensation for this issue.
I thank you for your help and ask for a reply to this message.
Peter Schwarz

acommodation: Habitaci贸n con 2 camas grandes
good_review: Easy to find the hotel. There was a Starbucks and Coffee shop with Pastries next door within walking distance. Nice size rooms, bed was very comfortable, slept like a baby or maybe jetlag from flying in from Singapore. Charging phone facilities was spot on. Reception staff Brandon was nice. He checked us in. Check out was easy and fast too. Breakfast was excellent.
bad_review:
Rooms - Bad Lighting, the room was pretty dark even with all the lights on. Our room faced the car park wall so no natural light could come thru. With the dark interior room look pretty dark.
Bathroom - no fan ventilation, bathroom door could not close smoothly all the way unless you force it a bit. Look like flooring was uneven. Wish there was another handle on the other side of door.
Bathroom sink area was small could not place night ameneties, wish it was bigger Alot of wasted space. More towel hooks or towel bars would be nice.
Housekeeping - overall the room was clean. However, we checked in at night around 9.30pm, one of the double bed sheets had red ants. About a dozen red ants. We killed it ourselves. Not sure where it came from. It just shows up like magic.
Secondly, the next morning Housekeeping staff did not knock and introduce themselves before coming in. I was in the bathroom, my girlfriend went down to the car so it wasn't double lock. I was washing up and I hear the door open and a man's voice, hello! I shouted that I was in the bathroom and he left. I quickly wiped my face and opened the room door and he was outside. I told him I did not want any housekeeping facilities. He did not quite understand and had to repeat "No need thank you" maybe more training on the staff part and a "Do Not Disturb" sign on the door handles or red light for no entry or something would be appropriate....
Car park entry - Confusing on the first entry. We had a reservation and we put in our tel number a few times and finally the banner went up. A few times we had to reverse our car as some other guest could not figure out how to get in.

Id recommend having brunch at the highlight room on the top floor or visiting it at night for a party. 
Note that this hotel is in Hollywood (very close to Hollywood BL) so expect it to be 1- loud (thin walls, and is adjacent to a busy restaurant/nightclub TAO that will blast music that you can hear from your room until right after 2am)
2- busy hotel and area (people and cars. at busy times ie weekend nights it takes ~20 minutes to arrive by car for a distance of 1km) 
3- The hotel only has valet Parking and it costs $60. It also takes time to bring the car (~10-15 minutes). Next to the hotel there is off street parking that is $40 overnight if you negotiate with them (ask for unlimited ins and outs)

acommodation: Habitaci贸n Silver con cama extragrande
review_title: Hollywood Dream Hotel: Prime Location, Comfortable Stay, and Exceptional Staff
good_review:
Upon arrival, I was greeted by a friendly and accommodating staff. They went above and beyond to ensure my needs were met and provided helpful information. The staff even informed me of nearby self-parking options, which saved me some money compared to opting for valet parking. This level of attentiveness and willingness to assist set a positive tone for my stay.
One aspect that pleasantly surprised me was the early check-in. While the official check-in time was stated as 4 pm, the staff kindly arranged for me to check in at 1 pm. This flexibility and willingness to accommodate guests' needs made me feel valued as a customer and added to the overall positive impression of the hotel.
One of the standout features of the Hollywood Dream Hotel is its prime location. Situated in the heart of Hollywood, it offers convenient access to various attractions and entertainment venues. This central location allowed me to easily explore the vibrant surroundings, maximizing my time in the area.
Furthermore, I appreciated the presence of Karl Langerfield cosmetics in the room. This upscale addition was a nice touch, catering to guests who appreciate luxurious amenities. The beds were exceptionally comfortable, ensuring a restful night's sleep and enhancing the overall comfort of the stay.
Additionally, the hotel's convenient coffee bar downstairs was a welcome feature. It provided a hassle-free option for grabbing a quick coffee or tea, allowing me to start my day on a positive note without venturing too far.
bad_review:
Moving on to the room itself, I booked the King Silver category. Although the actual room did not match the opulent aesthetics depicted in the promotional pictures, it still provided a comfortable and inviting atmosphere. The absence of openable windows was a drawback, as it made the room feel slightly confined. However, I would recommend selecting a room with a balcony for those seeking a more open and airy experience.
While the rooftop lounge was disappointingly only open on weekends, the hotel's lobby made up for it with its daily offering of complimentary wine and cheese. This thoughtful gesture added a touch of sophistication and provided a pleasant way to unwind after a day of exploration.

acommodation: Habitaci贸n Bronze con cama extragrande
review_title: Good except for Essex dinner order experience
good_review: Proximity to Hollywood proper; in general, most of it was good experience
bad_review: I get that not many guests order food to their rooms. But, still, the fact that it's advertised as an option in the room, all hotel staff should have knowledge of the status of its availability from their 3 promoted restaurants. I tried for an hour to use the QR code (based again on info provided in the room) to order dinner from Essex only to find out upon my departure that Essex no longer provides food ordered directly from the hotel. You may think "after 10 min, you should've given up, rather than waste an hour," but I did call both Dream staff and the restaurant and both told me there should be no technical probs with using the QR code on my phone. The QR code DID take me to their menu, and I was able to get as far as selecting items, but I would always be taken back to the beginning and was given an error code 500 on my phone. Since staff insisted it should work, I kept trying to no avail. I ended up ordering Door Dash at likely extra expense for del fee, etc. just to try the menu items that looked appetizing. I should've guessed something was "off" since the QR code menu offered items that were not options thru Door Dash. Anyway, I doubt you have many travelers complaining about this sort of thing, so I'm sure my concerns will be laughed off as unimportant. With all respect would not be surprised as in this millenium it has been "pay more for less." We are now being asked to give tips on just about every electronic order now and this is after inflation is already killing us - and we're not talking about extra or above and beyond service - we're talking about being asked for tips from workers who are basically doing bare minimum at their jobs and handing us a bag over the counter.

bad_review: Bar closed at 10pm, and for majority of the time the hotel was given over to non-paying guests, which meant that we couldnt get near the pool for pool parties, again given over to people with day passes, and with extremely loud music the entire day. Worse still though was the fact that my husband was involved in an armed robbery (involving guns) outside the front door of the hotel, on the hotel grounds, and the hotel management did not either come to his aid immediately after the robbery or follow up during our entire stay. For a hotel on Sunset strip with such a high profile and such a long, rich history the security levels for guests was minimal, despite them being aware of numerous such robberies in and around that location in the weeks leading up to our stay. Not sure I would risk staying there in the future.

As we had no rental car we walked a lot and the hotel location was great for this - proximity to breakfast places, pharmacy, beer/wine stores, was convenient. Just ask for a coffee maker in your room and they'll provide a pod-type one along with cream/sugar.

(FYI - the nightly cost of this was brought down from $40/night and several 'no I won't pay that much per night' for an upgrade moments) Not sure if this is common practice? 
Also was pressured/sales pitched to take a bus tour by the individual that checked us in - which we declined as we had already booked a tour. 
We were with 3 other couples who all received different cash valued coupons for the local restaurant/store. I think these values should be standardized??

acommodation: Queen Room with Two Queen Beds and Hollywood Hills View
bad_review: Check-in time is late (4 p.m.) and the pool bar closes at 5, just an hour after check-in. Also, the small rooftop pool (the main reason I chose this hotel), was too chilly for an evening swim. Summer is over and most CA hotel pools are heated. It was very disappointing not getting any enjoyment out of the pool. The hotel was understaffed and my check-in was delayed (by 4 p.m. this should not be the case). The rooms lacked any style. The "restaurant" menu offered only a short list of bar food items. The food was average at best. After staying at the beautiful and well-appointed Maui Andaz, this experience was an expensive regret. Next time in West Hollywood, I will stay at the Mondrian where the rooms have style and the pool is heated.

acommodation: Habitaci贸n con vistas a la calle - 2 camas grandes
review_title: Hire actual adult humans with brains and perhaps even a conscience and things might improve.
good_review: The property is fine if youre interested in being on Sunset. Its loud and faux hip, but fine.
bad_review:
As my profession requires almost constant travel and Im more likely found in an upscale hotel than at home, its a lot to say that Ive never had such a rude, disrespectful and idiotic experience with staff at a hotel. Although this isnt exactly an upscale hotel. Nevertheless-
I visited with a group that reserved and prepaid for our reservations months in advance. Because the trip involved a special occasion, one of the prepaid reservations was for the Penthouse Suite.
After requesting a slightly early check-in in advance, and confirming the request in person a few hours in advance, we arrived around 2pm to find the room wasnt ready. That was ok, if slightly disappointing as we were told it would be fine.
We waited until the published check-in time of 4pm, only to be told it still wasnt ready. At 4:45pm we were scheduled to leave for an event soon and had not showered. The front desk told us the room had some problems, including spilled shampoo on the carpet (??)
Their solution was to provide a key to a regular room so we could shower before departing for the event. Obviously disappointing , but trying to roll with our schedule, we were assured the room would be available when we returned from the event.
We returned to the hotel around 11pm and were informed the suite wasnt going to be available at all due to problems of an unknown nature.

review_title: see property likes. amazing stay. amazing staff!
good_review:
clean fresh fun location excellent food quality service all really good. the room was large modern yet functional with good lighting. This was my second stay primarily because my go to property the edition was not only twice as much for room but also for any food intake. Moreover they were never very accommodating. In fact in the London property where they have tiny candles on the front desk my belongings caught fire and they did nothing for me or about it. Not even a coffee for heavens sake in spite of me writing to management repeatedly about the fire hazard and the damage/loss it caused me.
I switched to andaz for a one night stay and arrived early from Palm Springs and a gentleman at the front desk with exceptional charm named John took care of us. The room wasnt ready so he had the manager upgrade us immediately checking in. Thereafter we were repeatedly asked how we were enjoying our accommodations. So I returned. . . This time a week.
Once again exceptional front desk service. John was there remembered me ( my sneakers- he is clearly a sneaker head too). They accommodated with a coffee machine - important for me because I wake up at 4:30 for exercise and without coffee I am not adequately fueled. I received a gorgeous huge room with a view of sunset. The gym is more than adequate and extraordinarily clean and fresh. The market and the coffee bar also high quality amazing food and service every time. At breakfast and for dinner at the bar one night.
Mid week I received important documents and did not have my laptop. Was working from my iPhone. I asked for a business center they said we dont have but what do you need? I said I needed papers printed then scanned and sent back with notations. Stuart from the front desk immediately gave me his email and said send to me I will get it done. Never ever mentioning charges of any kind. We got it done!
Another night towards the end of my stay my mobile was running low on battery.

acommodation: Suite con cama extragrande
good_review: The room was very well decorated. The hotel has a modern look and feel to it. The room was very large with good value for the price. The bathroom was awesome (walk in shower, bathtub, separate toilet, double vanity sink). The location was great, with lots of restaurants at walking distance.
bad_review: I was very disappointed by the view from the room. The pictures on the website and on Booking showed stunning views from the room. I had even paid extra for the "view" option as listed in the room details. We ended up in a room having as a view the other building in front of the hotel, with the nice view only showing from a very specific angle of one of the windows, so you would never have the nice view just by walking around in the room, but by specifically going to the window and looking from an angle. Overpromised underdelivered. This was for a honeymoon stay so we expected the magical views as advertised but ended up with a very depressing, gloomy view. Also, no coffee machine in the room, no booklet of instructions on how to connect to wifi or what number to dial to call the front office (had to guess it was "0"). No complimentaty water bottle in the minibar. Very big TVs but cannot cast iphone or ipad content to it, so pretty useless. No possibility to use your own apps like Netflix or HBO on your device to cast it on the TV and no such app directly on the TV. So the TV was pretty much useless with a useless OS. "Connecting your device" to the TV through using the menu option on the TV only allows you to use your device as a remote confroller (changing channels and volume) which is the most useless type of usage you can have, since there is a physical remote controller for that. There is some chromecast option stuff but too complicated to set up and not compatible with Apple device. In 2022 most TVs allow you to just cast your content but not the TVs on the hotels with their poorly designed OS.

acommodation: Queen Room with Two Queen Beds and Hollywood Hills View
good_review:
Hotel moderno e con carattere. Camera spaziosa e silenziosa, letto comodo (eravamo in due e avevamo un matrimoniale king a testa) e bella l'illuminazione (lampade Artemide e comoda la lucina segnapasso che si accende automaticamente quando scendi dal letto).
Ottimo il servizio parcheggio con chiamata dell'auto via SMS (il servizio si paga caro, ma non ci sono alternative migliori in zona), personale gentilissimo e posizione top sulla Sunset strip (scendi e trovi tutto quello che vuoi).
Carina la piscina sul roof top con vista sulle ville di west hollywood.
Per la maggior parte delle persone 茅 un'esperienza tendente al costoso (me compreso), ma ne vale la pena e ci ritornerei.

review_title: Good for kids but at a high price

Plus the door to the bathroom in our room was derailed from the track and making noise through the nigh. We managed to fix it at some point, but considering the 400$ a night, I expected the hotel to check if there is any issue in the room before putting people in it. bad_review:
There are so many "extras" hotel customers have to pay for, overnight parking is $45 dollars and resort fee is another $60/$70 dollars. Outside of the amount we see at the booking site, it's like another $150 dollars we have to pay. 
The hotel check-in time is 4pm. And check-out time is 11am. The water slides is closed at 5pm and opens at 11am. So for 1 night stays hotel customers they only get to use the water slides for "ONE HOUR"? That doesn't seem to be right. Most hotel check-in is around 3pm and check out at 12. So at least that's two more hours there if you have kids and coming for their water slides. I'm not saying this is not a nice/worth staying hotel, but the price range is on the higher side. I think 3pm check-in and 12pm check out will make you a fair hotel. (Instead of trying to cut your service and facility hours short)

review_title: Large comfy modern rooms, with great staff, but the location wasn't for me.
good_review: I stayed a couple of nights at the Andaz in SD, the room was large, bathroom was clean, the bed were really comfy and huge, plus the staff were great and informative. I didn't have breakfast at the hotel but there are some great places close by to grab coffee with good healthy breakfast choices. I requested a quiet room, so I didn't have a room that faced the road, whilst the view wasn't amazing, I had a good night's sleep w/ no disturbances.
bad_review: This hotel is probably a little tired and needs a bit of TLC in places - just general wear and tear issues. However, my main issue is no fault of the hotel and has more to do with the location and the homeless population in SD which is on its doorstep. As a woman travelling alone, I did not feel safe in this area, esp' in the evening. And if I were to visit again, I wouldn't opt to stay here.

acommodation: Habitaci贸n con cama extragrande.
review_title: Relaxing and conveniently located by everything.
good_review: I loved how comfortable the bed was. I felt like it was hugging me to sleep. I loved the air conditioning, the plasma screen tv, the fact that the snacks in the room were complimentary, as well as the waters in the mini fridge. I loved that the elevators and door to your room are activated only from your room key. I loved being able to see the view from the rroftop l, and that there was a comfortable sitting area and pool to enjoy. The bath tub we had was huge which was nice to soothe in. And we had a nice view. Overall, it was a nice experience especially since it was our first time in San Diego.
bad_review:
The parking was the only thing I didn't really like. You have to stop and pull over to the side of the sidewalk, but it is amongst oncoming traffic and the cars are parked all around the building making it difficult to pull over to check in. There is also no self-parking for guests who are checked in, only valet. Tye valet were noce folks, and I didn't mind the option to valet, but it was difficult since you had to stop in the middle of traffic for them to notice you. 
Also I felt that the price you have to pay to keep your car there overnight for each night you stay as a guest was way to pricey.

review_title: Convenient location, friendly staff, but more likely 4-stars, definitely not 5.
good_review:
The location in downtown San Diego was great. It is central to everything (freeways, Petco Park, the Gaslamp District, Seaport Village). The staff was very nice and attentive. And the room was clean. 
The rooftop bar, pool and atmosphere were top notch. The food was great.
bad_review:
I stayed in a room with two double beds. The room was on the second floor (room 231) and it had no view of anything. It looked out at some makeshift rock garden and the side of a building. This room was not commensurate with the 5-star designation that I thought I was getting. 
Additionally, the hotel is very close to the Salvation Army and there were many homeless people sitting on the sidewalk on the side of the hotel smoking various things. Not really 5 stars if you are afraid to walk on a street right next to the hotel.

The service was very poor, wife and I spent 7 nights / 8 days there, not once did we get a full housekeeping of the room, when we arrived reception explained thay have a eco policy not changing the sheets or towels every day - every 3 days. Which we agreed too with reassurance that if we needed anything they would do.
The room was cleanish, not much hanging or draw space. After 2 nights I asked if the room could get a service due to bins overflowing, sheets were soiled with sweat , Reception refused and we made a compromise to empty bins and it would get a service the next day. On the next day after seeing the cleaner on our floor for 4 hours I asked if she could do our room. Our room never got hoovered, sink, shower cleaned, restocked complementary treats. I had to ask for towels to be swapped- there wasnt one thing they did without me asking. The tea, coffee and hit milk was nothing special I did highlight my dissatisfaction over it all.
We waited a long time to be served at the rooftop and in the end we would go to bar and get served.
Overall with the little things on top of each other Ill give this hotel a miss.

When we first arrived, the hotel room given to us was not even ready. When we got up to the room, the housekeepers were literally just about to go into the room and looked horrified when we told them that was the room assigned to us. We were quickly switched to a better location, but then as I was going through the towels that evening, I came across a damp and disgusting towel that was discolored and folded up with all the clean towels. Bed was great.

bad_review:
The "destination" or "resort" charge of $30, which many hotels now apply, are annoying at best, and a rip off at worst. During my stay I leaned towards the latter, as the hotel was still in Covid mode and many services were trimmed or restricted, including the rooftop pool, which was open but no food/drink service.
However, in this case I am giving the hotel an overall good rating because I had a good room rate and the staff was great; but again, the destination charges didn't feel like good value for money on this occasion.

acommodation: Loft
Loft
good_review:
- The shower was obviously still dirty as there were two different kinds of hair in there.
- The toilet bowl had a film of dirt in it and a little hair.
- The desk had sticky residue and cup rings on it.
I am convinced this room was not cleaned properly and it is very concerning given that we are in a pandemic and they did not ensure extra measures were taken outside of having the remote in a plastic bag and putting a sticker that says sanitized on the hair dryer. I do not want to stay at this hotel ever again, I expected better and probably could have gotten better at a Motel 6.
Lastly, I called valet a little before 7 AM and was told he would be there with my car in under 10 minutes. I rushed to not be late since I figured he should be on time because it was early, not many people and no traffic. I waited outside in the cold with my bags for 15 minutes and decided to ask the front desk agent if valet was really on their way with my car, from the conversation it sounds like they didnt even leave yet. I waited a few more minutes and the valet attendant finally arrived, no apology for having me wait, knowing they had no other people waiting, so they should have been there at the time they gave. The only person who offered good service was the female front desk agent who checked me in.
